content:
@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #88764 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?

a bit cryptic for me. I think the reporter tried to compile Servo on Windows with the latest nightly and encountered some unimplemented UWP API?

anyway, maybe a ping to the windows folks could be of use. The mentioned issue #87074 is tracking a work in progress so someone there could know better

@apiraino I think the issue is that there is some UWP-specific code that is conditionally compiled but not tested on CI. And when I/O safety was implemented, the Windows Handle type's field changed such that the UWP-specific code has type errors.
I don't think the Windows team needs to be pinged; the UWP code just needs to be updated and checked to make sure it compiles.
Since this is blocking Servo's rustc upgrade, maybe P-high?
(Although UWP is a Tier 3 target according to Forge.)

ah interesting, I wasn't aware that UWP was treated as a separate support tier.
You make a good point about Servo builds being broken (although a Tier 3 - which usually I wouldn't go as far as P-high - this is probably an exception).
by the way I think the label O-windows-msvc you added and then removed was indeed correct, right? The target is compiled with MSVC compiler (--target x86_64-uwp-windows-msvc)

apiraino said:

by the way I think the label O-windows-msvc you added and then removed was indeed correct, right? The target is compiled with MSVC compiler (--target x86_64-uwp-windows-msvc)

Yeah that's why I added it, but it's possible it could be an issue on windows-gnu too, so I removed it to avoid confusing anyone :)
